00028    template <typename Data>
00029    class ListArray 
00030    { 
00031    
00032    public: 
00033    
00037       ListArray();
00038    
00044       virtual ~ListArray();
00045     
00052       void allocate(int capacity, int nList);
00053    
00059       int nList() const;
00060 
00066       int capacity() const
00067       { return capacity_; }
00068 
00075       Data& operator[] (int i)
00076       {
00077          assert(nodes_ != 0);
00078          assert(i < capacity_);
00079          assert(i >= 0);
00080          return nodes_[i].data();
00081       }
00082 
00089       const Data& operator[] (int i) const
00090       {
00091          assert(nodes_ != 0);
00092          assert(i < capacity_);
00093          assert(i >= 0 );
00094          return nodes_[i].data();
00095       }
00096 
00103       List<Data>& list(int i);
00104    
00111       const List<Data>& list(int i) const;
00112 
00119       Node<Data>& node(int i);
00120    
00124       bool isValid() const;
00125    
00126    private:
00127   
00128       // C array of Node<Data> objects 
00129       Node<Data> *nodes_;
00130    
00131       // C array of List<Data> objects
00132       List<Data> *lists_;
00133    
00134       // Allocated size of nodes_ array.
00135       int         capacity_;
00136    
00137       // Number of lists.
00138       int         nList_;
00139    
00140    };

00143    /* 
00144    * Default constructor.
00145    */
00146    template <typename Data>
00147    ListArray<Data>::ListArray()
00148     : nodes_(0),    
00149       lists_(0),
00150       capacity_(0),
00151       nList_(0)
00152    {}
00153 
00154    /* 
00155    * Destructor.
00156    *
00157    * Delete dynamically allocated arrays of Data, Node, and List objects.
00158    */
00159    template <typename Data>
00160    ListArray<Data>::~ListArray()
00161    {
00162       if (nodes_ != 0) {
00163          delete [] nodes_; 
00164          nodes_ = 0;
00165       }
00166       if (lists_ != 0) {
00167          delete [] lists_; 
00168          lists_ = 0;
00169       }
00170    }
00171  
00172    /* 
00173    * Allocate arrays of Data objects, list nodes, and linked lists.
00174    *
00175    * \param capacity size of arrays of Data and ListNode<Data> objects
00176    * \param nList    size of array of List<Data> linked list objects
00177    */
00178    template <typename Data>
00179    void ListArray<Data>::allocate(int capacity, int nList) 
00180    {
00181       int i;
00182       capacity_ = capacity;
00183       nList_    = nList;
00184 
00185       // Allocate array of nodes
00186       nodes_  = new Node<Data>[capacity_];
00187 
00188       // Allocate and initialize lists
00189       lists_ = new List<Data>[nList_];
00190       for (i=0; i < nList_; ++i) {
00191          lists_[i].initialize(nodes_, capacity_);
00192       }
00193 
00194    }
00195 
00196    /* 
00197    * Get the number of associated linked lists.
00198    *
00199    * \return size of array of associated List<Data> objects.
00200    */
00201    template <typename Data>
00202    inline int ListArray<Data>::nList() const
00203    { return nList_;}
00204 
00205    /* 
00206    * Return a reference to a specific List.
00207    *
00208    * \param  i  array index
00209    * \return reference to List number i
00210    */
00211    template <typename Data>
00212    List<Data>& ListArray<Data>::list(int i) 
00213    { 
00214       assert(lists_ != 0); 
00215       assert(i >= 0); 
00216       assert(i < nList_); 
00217 
00218       return *(lists_ + i); 
00219    }
00220 
00221    /* 
00222    * Return a const reference to a specific List.
00223    *
00224    * \param  i  array index
00225    * \return reference to List number i
00226    */
00227    template <typename Data>
00228    const List<Data>& ListArray<Data>::list(int i) const
00229    { 
00230       assert(lists_ != 0); 
00231       assert(i >= 0); 
00232       assert(i < nList_); 
00233 
00234       return *(lists_ + i); 
00235    }
00236 
00237    /* 
00238    * Return reference to node number i.
00239    *
00240    * \param  i  array index
00241    * \return reference to Data object element number i
00242    */
00243    template <typename Data>
00244    Node<Data>& ListArray<Data>::node(int i) 
00245    { 
00246       assert(nodes_ != 0); 
00247       assert(i >= 0); 
00248       assert(i < capacity_); 
00249 
00250       return *(nodes_ + i); 
00251    }
00252 
00253    /*
00254    * Return true if the ListAray is valid, or throw an exception.
00255    */
00256    template <typename Data>
00257    bool ListArray<Data>::isValid() const
00258    {
00259       int i;
00260 
00261       if (nodes_ != 0) {
00262          if (lists_ == 0) {
00263             UTIL_THROW("nodes_ is allocated but lists_ is not");
00264          }
00265 
00266          // Check validity of all lists 
00267          for (i=0; i < nList_ ; ++i) {
00268             if (!lists_[i].isValid()){
00269                UTIL_THROW("Invalid list in ListArray");
00270             }
00271          }
00272 
00273       } else {
00274 
00275          if (lists_ != 0) {
00276             UTIL_THROW("nodes_ is not allocated but lists_ is");
00277          }
00278 
00279       }
00280       return true;
00281 
00282    }
00283 
00284 }
